ca.uhn.hl7v2.hoh.api

Interface IClient

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IClientMultithreaded, IClientSimple
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClient, AbstractRawClient, HohClientMultithreaded, HohClientSimple, HohRawClientMultithreaded, HohRawClientSimple, RelayHttpSender

    public interface IClient

    • Method Detail

      • getHost

        String getHost()
        Getter for the host (e.g. "10.0.0.111" or "localhost")

      • getPort

        int getPort()
        Getter for the port (e.g. 80 for standard HTTP)

      • getSocketFactory

        ISocketFactory getSocketFactory()
        Returns the socket factory used by this client

      • getUriPath

        String getUriPath()
        Getter for the "Path" portion of the URL. This is the path portion which comes after the host and port, so for example if this client is being used to send messages to http://somehost.com:8888/messaging/receiver.jsp, the URI path portion would be /messaging/receiver.jsp

      • getUrl

        URL getUrl()
        Getter for the URL to send messages to.

      • setAuthorizationCallback

        void setAuthorizationCallback(IAuthorizationClientCallback theAuthorizationCallback)
        If set, provides a callback which will be used to se the username and password associated with the request

      • setCharset

        void setCharset(Charset theCharset)

        Sets the charset to use for requests from this client. May be changed at any time.

        Default is UTF-8

      • setHost

        void setHost(String theHost)
        Setter for the host (e.g. "10.0.0.111" or "localhost")

      • setKeepAlive

        void setKeepAlive(boolean theKeepAlive)
        Configures the TCP KeepAlive flag for new connections
        See Also:
        Socket.getKeepAlive()

      • isKeepAlive

        boolean isKeepAlive()
        Returns the TCP KeepAlive flag for new connections
        See Also:
        Socket.getKeepAlive()

      • setSoTimeout

        void setSoTimeout(int theSoTimeout)
        Sets the TCP SO Timeout setting for new connections
        See Also:
        Socket.getSoTimeout()

      • getSoTimeout

        int getSoTimeout()
        Returns the TCP SO Timeout setting for new connections
        See Also:
        Socket.getSoTimeout()

      • setUriPath

        void setUriPath(String thePath)
        Setter for the "Path" portion of the URL. This is the path portion which comes after the host and port, so for example if this client is being used to send messages to http://somehost.com:8888/messaging/receiver.jsp, the URI path portion would be /messaging/receiver.jsp

      • setPort

        void setPort(int thePort)
        Getter for the port (e.g. 80 for standard HTTP)

      • setResponseTimeout

        void setResponseTimeout(long theResponseTimeout)
        Sets the number of milliseconds before timing out. Default is #DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT
        Parameters:
        theResponseTimeout - The millis to wait before timeout.
        See Also:
        #DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT

      • setSigner

        void setSigner(ISigner theSigner)
        Parameters:
        theSigner - If provided, sets the Signature Profile signer implementation to use. See http://hl7api.sourceforge.net/hapi-hl7overhttp/specification. html#SIGNATURE_PROFILE

      • setSocketFactory

        void setSocketFactory(ISocketFactory theSocketFactory)
        Sets the socket factory used by this client. Default is StandardSocketFactory.
        See Also:
        ISocketFactory

      • setUrl

        void setUrl(URL theUrl)
        Setter for the URL to send messages to. Note that invoking this method replaces any values that have been provided to setHost(String), setPort(int), or setUriPath(String)

      • setUrlString

        void setUrlString(String theString)
        Setter for the URL to send messages to. Note that invoking this method replaces any values that have been provided to setHost(String), setPort(int), or setUriPath(String)

      • getUrlString

        String getUrlString()
        Getter for the URL to send messages to.
